paragraph.paragraph: There are two ways a debugged application can be interrupted: its execution can be paused, or it can be killed.
Two methods can be used to pause a debugged application:

list.item:
The
/tools/eiffelstudio/reference/40_debugger/10_execution/70_pause_execution.xml stop command/images/eiffelstudio/icons/icon_exec_stop_color.gif , located in both the debug menu and the project toolbar.
Breakpoints, which make it easy to stop the application at a precise point.

paragraph.paragraph:
To kill a debugged application, use the
/tools/eiffelstudio/reference/40_debugger/10_execution/80_kill_application.xml kill command/images/eiffelstudio/icons/icon_exec_quit_color.gif , located in both the debug menu and the project toolbar.
